Sustainment: Maintenance
   
 

  Three Level Maintenance

Three level maintenance normally results in maintenance actions occurring at three locations as shown in the left column. Organizational maintenance is conducted by the activity “owning” the aircraft and could consist of inspection, servicing, and changing line replaceable units (LRUs). Intermediate level maintenance may involve additional skills required to repair LRUs by replacing shop replaceable units (SRUs). SRUs and more in depth repairs might be done by a depot.

The Air Force has used a variety of maintenance concepts throughout its history. The current thought is to move from three level to two level maintenance wherever practical.
